qas.question: How long has Switzerland hosted the United Nations Human Rights Council?
What is the second biggest centre for the U.N.?
Where did the Red Crescent Movement begin?
Where is the League of Nations located?

context: A large number of international institutions have their seats in Switzerland, in part because of its policy of neutrality. <a2_0>Geneva<a2_0/> is the birthplace of the Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement and the Geneva Conventions and, <a0_0>since 2006<a0_0/>, hosts the United Nations Human Rights Council. Even though Switzerland is one of the most recent countries to have joined the United Nations, the <a1_0>Palace of Nations in Geneva<a1_0/> is the second biggest centre for the United Nations after New York, and <a3_0>Switzerland<a3_0/> was a founding member and home to the League of Nations.
